Class TokenReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • TokenReader

  • public class TokenReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to tokenize Descartes 2 source code for the various parsing methods used by each node in the parse tree. It provides the getToken() method the infamous assignment of the same name.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TokenReader(java.lang.String fileName, java.io.InputStream stream)
      Construct a new TokenReader instance, with source code being read from the specified stream.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean atEnd()
      Returns true if there are no more tokens to read from the input stream.
      java.lang.String fileName()
      Returns the name of the source code file that this TokenReader is reading from.
      TokenDescriptor getToken()
      Reads a token from the input stream into a TokenDescriptor and returns it.
      static boolean isPunct(int ch)
      Java's Character class inexplicably has no isPunct() method, so this one will suffice.
      int lineNum()
      Returns the current line number in the source code file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      java.lang.String readAlpha()
      Read a token that begins with a letter of the alphabet.
      java.lang.String readNumber()
      Read a numeric constant into a String and return it.
      void readSpace()
      Returns a whitespace token as read from the input stream.
      void unread(TokenDescriptor descrip)
      Puts the token in 'descrip' back into the stream so that can be read at a later time.

      • readNumber

        public java.lang.String readNumber()
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   DCSyntaxErrorException
        Read a numeric constant into a String and return it.
        Returns:
        The String representation of a numeric literal token.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while reading from the InputStream
        DCSyntaxErrorException - Thrown if a syntax error is detected in the source code

                           throws java.io.IOException,

        Read a token that begins with a letter of the alphabet.
        Returns:
        An alphanumeric token read from the source code
        Throws:

               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a whitespace token as read from the input stream.

      • getToken

        public TokenDescriptor getToken()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                DCSyntaxErrorException
        Reads a token from the input stream into a TokenDescriptor and returns it.
        Returns:
        The token read from the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while reading from the InputStream
        DCSyntaxErrorException - Thrown if a syntax error is detected in the source code

      • unread

        public void unread(TokenDescriptor descrip)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Puts the token in 'descrip' back into the stream so that can be read at a later time. This is useful for "peeking" into the stream and making descisions about tokens before they're read.
        Parameters:
        descrip - The token to replace in the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the underlying PushbackInputStream used to read source code throws it

      • atEnd

        public boolean atEnd()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns true if there are no more tokens to read from the input stream.
        Returns:
        true if there are no more tokens to read from the input stream, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while interacting with the source code InputStream

      • fileName

        public java.lang.String fileName()
        Returns the name of the source code file that this TokenReader is reading from. This is useful for reporting syntax errors.
        Returns:
        The name of the source code file currently being read.

      • lineNum

        public int lineNum()
        Returns the current line number in the source code file. This is useful for reporting syntax errors.
        Returns:
        The line number currently being read in the source code file

      • isPunct

        public static boolean isPunct(int ch)
        Java's Character class inexplicably has no isPunct() method, so this one will suffice. It only includes characters found in the language's operators.
        Parameters:
        ch - The character to test
        Returns:
        true
        if 
        ch
        is a punctuation character, 
        false
        otherwise

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
